    • Constructor Detail

      • Fraction

        public Fraction(int numerator,
                int denominator)
        Constructs numerator and denominator if user inputs two integers.
        Parameters:
        numerator - The integer to be numerator.
        denominator - The integer to be denominator.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if denominator is 0.

      • Fraction

        public Fraction(int wholeNumber)
        Constructs numerator and denominator. If user only inputs one number, that number will be assigned to numerator. And assigns 1 to denominator.
        Parameters:
        wholeNumber - The integer to be numerator.

      • Fraction

        public Fraction(java.lang.String fraction)
        Constructs numerator and denominator. If user inputs a string fraction.
        Parameters:
        fraction - The first integer in the fraction is numerator, the second integer in the fraction is denominator.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArithmeticException - if denominator is 0.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public Fraction add(Fraction f)
        Adds this fraction to Fraction F and returns the sum of this Fraction and the Fraction f.
        Parameters:
        f - The Fraction to be added to this one.
        Returns:
        The sum of the two Fractions.

      • subtract

        public Fraction subtract(Fraction f)
        Subtracts Fraction F from this Fraction. Returns a new Fraction that is the difference of this Fraction and the Fraction F.
        Parameters:
        f - The Fraction to be subtracted to this Fraction.
        Returns:
        The difference of this Fraction and the Fraction F.

      • multiply

        public Fraction multiply(Fraction f)
        Multiplys this Fraction by Fraction F. Returns a new Fraction that is the product of this and the Fraction f.
        Parameters:
        f - The Fraction to be multiplied to this one.
        Returns:
        The product of this fraction and the Fraction f.

      • divide

        public Fraction divide(Fraction f)
        Divides this Fraction by Fraction F. Returns a new Fraction that is the quotient of dividing this by the Fraction F.
        Parameters:
        f - The Fraction to be divided by this one.
        Returns:
        The quotient of dividing this Fraction by the Fraction F.

      • abs

        public Fraction abs()
        Makes this Fraction to be absolute number. Returns a new Fraction that is the absolute value of this fraction.
        Returns:
        The absolute value of this Fraction.

      • negate

        public Fraction negate()
        Makes the opposite sign of this Fraction.
        Returns:
        The opposite sign of this Fraction.

      • inverse

        public Fraction inverse()
        Inverses this Fraction.
        Returns:
        The inverse of this fraction.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Checks Object o is a Fraction. If it is a fraction, checks this Fraction is equal to Object o.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - Object o.
        Returns:
        boolean. Returns true if o is a Fraction equal to this, and false in all other cases.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
        Checks Object o is a Fraction or an int. If it is, checks this Fraction is smaller, bigger or equal to Object o.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        o - Object o.
        Returns:
        A negative int if this is less than o. Zero if this is equal to o. A positive int if this is greater than o.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - If o is neither a Fraction nor an int.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts illegitimate format of Fraction to legitimate format, n/d, where n is the numerator and d is the denominator. For example, if d is 1, just return n (as a String) and the returned String should not contain any blanks. If the fraction represents a negative number, a minus sign should precede the n.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The legitimate format of Fraction.
